void* Alloc (  size_t  size  ) 
 

Returns:
pointer to allocated block. May return NULL or throw std::bad_alloc, if not enough memory
See also:
Winnie::Config::throw_std_bad_alloc
Parameters:
size: if size` is bigger than malloc_threshold, standart malloc function used.
See also:
Winnie::Config::malloc_threshold

void DesroyHeap (   ) 
 

free all consumed from OS memory and return to zero-initialized state.

frees a memory block, which was allocated whith Winnie::Alloc

See also:
WINNIE_ALLOC_STATISTIC_ENABLED

size_t MSize (  void *  p  ) 
 

Returns actual number of bytes in allocated block, which can be more than requested by user.

void* Realloc (  void *  p,
size_t  size
) 
 

Reallocate memory blocks

Parameters:
p Pointer to previously allocated memory block
size New size in bytes The contents of the block are unchanged up to the shorter of the new and old sizes, although the new block can be in a different location

Variable Documentation

const unsigned Winnie::max_lists_num = 31
 

number of free block lists, which holds blocks of size 1, 2, 4, 8, ..., 2GB
